Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: coollondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel, upstairs in an one bedroom appartment on 21st March 2012. It was really nice, very clean; the kitchen was fully equipped, had all the stuff, even the washing up liquid. You may get a bit of noice from a bar next door, but we stayed during the week so it was ok. The cottages on the peir booked about 7 month in advance so almost no chance there. The owners of the place very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights wasnt enough”
Reviews.Author: phillymikeb52s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crystal Pier last week for only 3 nights, and then went up to coast a bit for a few more days. If I had known (and if there was vacancies) I would have stayed all week! It was awesome...Nothing like it! I stayed in Cottage D, which was over the water even at low tide. When the tide was up, you could see surfers riding waves right by your room as you sat in the living room. The sound and feel of the waves crashing beneath you are just the coolest most relaxing thing ever. When I do return, I will want that same cottage. A&B are the 2 on the end, but you get more privacy from the public pier on the end. Another great feature is your car is parked right alongside your cottage (easy for loading/unloading!) The staff was amazingly friendly, and has your safety and privacy priority! Thankyou Randy for all your helpful tips on tours, eateries, and directions. I will look fwd to becoming a regular here as I know many people have!

Reviews.Title: “An Aging Classic”
Reviews.Author: SOCIAWG
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Crystal Pier in both the cottages and “motel” suites over the past ten years. This week, we stayed in cottage # 8 having taken advance of an off-season rate of $175.00 per night. There is no place like it – the cottages sit over the ocean, you hear the sound of the surf (what a pleasant way to go to sleep) and have a nice outside space with a table, four chairs, umbrella and two lounge chairs, overlooking the beach. The bed is comfortable, but I did not like the pillows so if you are driving in, you may want to bring a pillow you like. The views from your cottage or motel room are fantastic, but if you stay in one of the motel rooms, consider bringing ear plugs to cope with the noise level from the boardwalk, especially on summer weekends. Each cottage has a basic kitchen (refrigerator, oven with stove top and microwave – it didn’t have a revolving tray) and is stocked with Ikea glasses, plates, flatware, cooking utensils, pots and pans, off-brand toaster and coffee maker (my wife doesn’t like the coffee it makes). You have a parking space too (no extra charge). Kono’s (great breakfast place) is just outside the gate to the Crystal Pier and there is a CVS and Ralph’s grocery store within walking distance. You are just steps away from the beach and Mission bay. If you want modern appliances, flat-screen TVs or fancy bathrooms with rain showers or tubs, this is not the place for you. The cottages are showing their age – the plumbing fixtures were basic to begin with and now need to be replaced. For example, the shower head in # 8 could not be adjusted because of accumulated hard-water deposits and it was very difficult to adjust the temperature of the water. Also, it is apparent that the wrong shower stall was installed in # 8 (it should have been reversed to place the molded seat at the end opposite the shower head). There are no drawers in the bathroom vanity, but fortunately there is a dresser in the bedroom where you can put your cosmetics, etc. The TV in # 8 is a TV/DVD player combo unit that is no more than 19 inches and definitely not HD. While free wifi is offered, reception is problematic – neither of our iPad2’s could connect, but my laptop could. Still a wonderful place to stay, but don’t except luxurious appointments even though in-season rates are premium prices, just basic beach appointments and be sure to pet the pier dog.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with an ocean lullaby everynight!”
Reviews.Author: MiscMel
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again! The cottages are on a pier stretching into the ocean. Every night you can hear the waves crashing against the pier and it is, honest to God, the most beautiful lullaby. Our cottage was a one bedroom with a living room and kitchen and we could sit on the sofa and look out the patio door onto the ocean and even see the surfers! It was clean and nicely appointed with the decor keeping with the quaintness of the entire place. Although the pier opens to the public during the day, we had a privacy fence and felt entirely safe and secluded. In the evenings, after the pier is closed to the public, there is a wonderful security guard and gates that makes the entire place feel safe. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight above the Waves”
Reviews.Author: Thankful-desertite
Reviews.Content: Our 3-nite stay in the historic 2 bdrm, 2 bath cottage (#2) in the middle of the pier with another couple was delightful in every way. The cottage could not have been cleaner. It was cozy & well-appointed & private & quiet. The "roar" of the waves & the gentle shaking was unique and enjoyable. We watched surfers, sunsets, fishermen & dolphins from our lodging and from the end of the pier. The maintenance/housekeeping staff was courteous and quick. Walking the beach was a daily occurrence. Sharing the cost made it more affordable, but it's a once in a lifetime experience. Wish it could be an annual event!

Reviews.Title: “Way above expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuckeye
Reviews.Content: In early December I visited my very good friend who lives in the San Diego area. I had a few requests and one was to spend some time at the ocean. She booked the Crystal Pier as she had heard good comments from friends and we both were totally impressed with how fresh and clean the cabin was. Both of us are in the Interior Design related business and have an eye for details and finesse. The rooms were not over designed to say the least ...the futon sofa and rattan chairs were average but plenty good..but more importantly, the cabin was impeccably painted,very clean,we had everything from wine glasses to a fully appointed kitchen and bath. The heater did the job well and the shower was powerful. The scenery was the best on the beach as the pier decks overlooked the surf in both directions! It was a fabulous trip...so good I had to write the first travel review of my life....you just read it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique !”
Reviews.Author: bchapman23
Reviews.Content: This property is a must see and stay whie in San Diego. We stayed here two nights, the view was never the same. The cottages are comfortable and have enought space to make them functional. It would be hard to replicate the views anywhere. The only odd thing about this property is the cottages shift slightly when the waves hit the pier columns. It's not always noticeable but it would depend on the size of the waves. It adds to the unique atmosphere and experience. Would definantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed! Next time, I'd reserve a cottage further west”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoPhil
Reviews.Content: Very nice cottages, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in early December. You hear the waves crashing both from your private deck as well as from the interior of the cottage. The cottage had a wall furnace that quickly heated the place at night, plenty of windows, a private parking space right in front of the cottage. The LARGE semi-private deck came with a table with seating for 4, plus 2 chaise lounges (cushions for the outdoor seating are kept inside the cabin in the closet); by semi-private I mean this --> it is a very large deck that is solely for your own personal use, and it has a low fence around it, but you can see the deck of the guest next to you (very much like having a balcony in a hotel --- it is private, but you can see your neighbors if they are on their balcony). How to turn a 4star experience into a 5star experience: If I had to do it over again, I would reserve a room as far west on the pier as possible (i.e. as far away from the boardwalk as possible). We were in room 11, and although we loved the room, it had two downsides with not being very far west: a) late at night we would occasionally hear loud/drunk people walking along the boardwalk; Being further west would have alleviated this problem by not only being further from the boardwalk, but also the wave crashes would have been louder further west, thus muffling boardwalk noise even more. b) the cottage would shimmy, like a mild earthquake, whenever guests would drive their car past our cottage when driving to/fro their cottages. Some checked out at 6am, while others drove back from a late night out at 2:30am .... being a light sleeper caused me to wake up several times from the shimmying of the cottage; Had we been in a cabin further west, less cars would have passed by our cottage, and thus we gather we would have experienced less shimmying. Reserve many months in advance (they book up quickly) Their WiFi is spotty and slow at best. It was so bad that we ended up turning off our WiFi and instead relied on our 4G carrier's connection. Each cottage has a single parking space in front of it (you get a permit for 1 specific vehicle -- you are NOT allowed to change out vehicles there during your stay). As well, they come with a kitchen stocked with dishes, pots/pans, and utensils (including the ever so important corkscrew!).

Reviews.Title: “On The Ocean-For Real”
Reviews.Author: Ironmaid
Reviews.Content: I had never been to California and wanted to stay on the beach. This is a real beach expierence. The ocean is there 24/7. We stayed in a cottage right on the pier. It was lovely. A bit pricey, but for a family of six well worth it. Nice ambience, kitchen facilities,comfy beds and the sound of the sea! Plus we had the real beach and the action right there. It was overcast most of the time we were in town,so it was definately not "sunny" southern Cal.,but when you have a great place to stay it sure helps. :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here once and say "been there, done that".”
Reviews.Author: mishottie
Reviews.Content: The pier is definitely a tourist destination and staying in a cottage on the pier is a one time must do. That being said, the cottages are rustic - we had #14 and would have liked to be further out on the pier. Our friends stayed across at #15 and their unit was in slightly better condition than ours. There were some aesthetics that needed attention on the roof of our patio and in the bathroom and of course, rust is just part of being on the ocean, so you will see fixtures and appliances suffering from the elements. The unit was very clean and it was great to have a fridge, microwave and stove. Dishes, pots and pans, utensils, and wine glasses were even provided. We were there on a rainy night and the there were a few drops of rain coming in here and there, but nothing troubling. It would have been nice to have some rugs in the unit at the front door and slider as we came in and out with wet shoes and clothing. The last day we stayed the clouds cleared and the weather was beautiful and sitting out on the patio was quite peaceful. The area is full of bars and younger people - it would be great if you plan to go out and party withing walking distance. I am glad we went, but if I had not purchased a groupon for this property, I woud have been disappointed paying the 250-300 a night. I was not impressed with the area - it reminded me of newport beach or santa monica - I much prefer the central coast. Front desk staff were cordial, but not exactly warm and inviting. Don't expect much privacy in the numbered units as the patios all open on to eachother and you can see your neighbors...and so many people walking on the pier asking about the units and peering in can be obstrusive. Walking the pier when it is empty at night after they close it is very cool, though.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the sounds or the sunsets”
Reviews.Author: Darren Z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crystal Pier on the recommendation of a co-worker and it was everything she said it would be. We rented the last cottage at the end of the pier, right above the ocean, and I've never slept better in my life as the sound of the surf and the occasional "bump" from the waves rock you to sleep. Another plus is that there's many fine places to eat within walking distance. Expensive but highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: LIPSTICKLOULI
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and my husband and I have been going to these cottages now for four years. We go in April every year and loved it so much we now go for a weekend in November every year. None of us can ever wait to have out little fun weekend there. We always gets our two cottages side by side. Usually over the water. Cottage 5 and 3. The view is wonderful....the cottage is cozy and clean.......the waves lull you to sleep.....it's heaven on earth for two weekends a year! We are leaving tomorrow for our November weekend.......can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place--and my wife does not...”
Reviews.Author: Charlie8889
Reviews.Content: I love this place. There's nothing quite like being lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves directly beneath you. My wife, on the other hand, is not a Crystal Pier fan. Whatâ€™s not to like? The pier itself (not the hotel) is a wildly popular tourist destination. So itâ€™s true that throngs of people descend on the pier on a daily basis. And yes, theyâ€™re trudging right past your door if you happen to be sleeping late or home in mid-afternoon. My wife savors her privacy and would rather stay at a place that offers this. But they do close the pier to the public in the later evening, so you will have privacy after that point. Hereâ€™s my wifeâ€™s other gripe: On the other side of the cottagesâ€™ private decks facing the ocean, thereâ€™s a walkway for hotel guests. The first time we stayed here, our next door neighbor spent much of his time pacing back and forth on this walkway, while speaking loudly on his cell phone. In front of our phenomenal ocean view, we got a great view of him, again and again. But that was an isolated incident. Iâ€™m still a fan, and will be back when I can persuade my wife to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: Staying at this place is a must! Had cottage c and it was amazing! Awesome views, comfortable and clean. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway over the ocean!”
Reviews.Author: artstyinaz
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at these cottages for over 15 years and finally scored a Groupon deal. We were in Cottage E, toward the end of the pier and it was everything I had imagined! Cottages A-F have private decks and so worth it. In fact, we did not see or hear anyone...not even people walking on the pier, during our entire stay, and most of the cottages were occupied. The front desk was very helpful, directing us to places to rent beach cruisers and even allowing me to take a coffee cup and pay the next day (since I didn't have cash). Inside the cottage looks like a cozy beach "cabin". There were even a pair of binoculars for dolphin or whale sightings. Everything was very clean, all the windows open and the bedroom had a screen door to the deck. We left this open at night and let the ocean breeze in. With the windows & door open, the waves were very LOUD and made it hard to sleep if you're not used to a lot of noise. But we live in the desert and I wasn't about to close them! Also, the pier sways at times...similar to being on a cruise ship. The patio was a nice size and perfect views for morning coffee. Bring your own blanket if you sit out at night....guests are not allowed to take hotel blankets on the deck. Kitchen is small but works for what you need. Definitely eat at Kono's near the pier entrance. HUGE portions of food for small prices...cash only though! Loved this place...was worth the wait and can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning sea view, your own patio, perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vinkent
Reviews.Content: I took a walk along Crystal Pier just before leaving San Diego - and decided to see if I could get a room here. I had a studio room at the beginning of the pier, far cheaper than some of the hotels along the beach for a 'sea view', and this one was right on the beach. The room was clean, excellently equipped, beautiful setting and good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this unique experience.”
Reviews.Author: Sallybess
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! The cabin had so much charm. Great provisions in the kitchen. Beds were not remarkable, but for the location, it is something that can be overlooked. I will say that there is a lot of bar noise at night though. If you can swing the price, stay here. I will help you justifying it by saying it is not your run of the mill experience, and you can save money by eating food you make rather than eating out all of your vacation. Gringos Mexican restaurant was good though. Even if you order pizza (which we did one night), you can't beat the view and the sounds of the surf!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lisanmesa
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Diego several times and always wanted to stay at Crystal Pier. Finally my boyfriend said let's just do it and we do not regret any of it! We will be going back if not later this year, for sure next year. The cottage with the private patio allowed us to lounge in the sun without hauling everything down to the beach and the patio furniture is comfortable. We took our own music and had our own private party all weekend. We definately recommend this place for couples. The price is no more than it would be to rent a beach house to stay right on the beach. We even had a couples massage arranged and the girls came to our cottage and both tables fit perfectly in our living room. The furniture was wicker so it was easily moveable to accommodate. See Meagan in the office for the name of the agency we contacted. This was our first vacation together and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: lisabethshepard
Reviews.Content: so cozy and so peaceful the ocean breeze and sound is so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “just like the sign says, "sleep over the ocean"”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJMC
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a couple of cold blustery nights in March. I loved it! Our little cottage was bright and tidy with all the things you need for a comfortable stay--even binoculars! We had a very private little patio by our suite-type unit with a table, chairs, and lounges. Cushions were even stored neatly in the closet. we were just six miles from home, but I felt a world away. Might make it an annual winter outing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: RickandRenee
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier is spectacular, very clean and cozy. The view was amazing, watching the sunset was incredible. Wacthing Dolphins swim by in the morning was great. We walked the boardwalk from Pacific Beach down to Ocean beach and relized we made the best choice by staying here than anywhere else in the area.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME experience”
Reviews.Author: GJto3
Reviews.Content: The unique setting of sleeping in a cottage on a pier was amazing. The sound of the waves crashing was relaxing and put my to sleep instantly (which never happens). The cottages were quaint and very clean. I highly recommend the experience and would return again. It was fun watching the surfers surf from predawn to dusk. THe dolphin pods swam by regularly. The staff is friendly and helpful. We felt safe and secure with the gate at the pier opening.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lrcopp
Reviews.Content: This place is simply amazing. I have been coming here every summer since I was 3. Every June we stay 4 days. My Grandma, Mom, Husband and kids. Sometimes cousins come in from TX and ATL. This is literally our home away from home, even if it is only four days a year. Staying here is wonderful and relaxing. Access to the beach is a very short walk around the corner of the office. Along with great little shops to stop at along the way. We always rent bikes and ride as far as the bay. The best place to eat is right in front of the hotel. KONO'S has the best coffee and great food. Generous portions too. You can take your food outside where they have tables set up over the beach. Heaven! I could really go on and on about this place. It is sooo hard to leave when our time is up. But always look forward to the next year, where many memories have been made, and are still in the making. I wish I lived there. So stay at CP and experience heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God...”
Reviews.Author: sabine555
Reviews.Content: Thats the paradise. The Bungalows straight on the Bridge. We loved the place. It was the best spot on our Tour through the States. It isnt a five-star hotel - but it is the most relaxing place on earth. There is a kitchen inside, shower - no bathtub. Privat Balcony... So wonderful. The whole day you listen the waves. No breakfast - but there are some places around. No pool or jacuzzi. This is one of this places we will definitly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Such a wqnderful place I hate to write a review in fear it will be booked when I want to go again.”
Reviews.Author: dipper1225
Reviews.Content: Lovely, lovely place. We stayed in such a dump the night before that I was determined to spend the next two days somewhere wonderful. This was it. It just feel into our lap. I pulled into the Crystal Pier to ask about the hotel pricing. I thought for sure my daughter and I could not afford this place. But, I was pleasantly surprised and booked the room. It was more than I could have imagined. Plus, the weather was extraordinary and that helped. The cottage was fully equipted and clean and fresh. I laid and listened to the ocean waves all night. I felt safe, cozy and the staff was so so so nice. I just can't say enough. You can walk to everything you heart desires. We rented bikes for cheap and rode all over the place. I told my friends on Fb that this was a place that should be on everyone's bucket list. I will always have this special place in my heart as I walk through life. Thank you Crystal Pier and owners. Lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: MsMessmo
Reviews.Content: Loved everything except my next-door neighbors who sat on their deck and smoked, despite knowing it's a smoke-free hotel. So I couldn't spend as much time on my own deck as I would have liked and had to close my windows on that side to keep out the smell. Location can't be beat and the rooms were really cozy and clean. I'll be back and the next time I'll complain to the management about the smokers if necessary!

Reviews.Title: “If you love the ocean - then this is staying in paradise”
Reviews.Author: ukpete51
Reviews.Content: We travelled 3000 miles in a 3 week road trip, and stumbled upon this motel whilst looking for an hotel with a sea view. Wow - sea view?? We were blown away (not literally). The staff were lovely. They only had 1 night spare (we did beg) but it was enough to know that when we return to the States, we will be booking 4 nights (San Diego itself wouldn't hold enough interest for us). The bungalow was towards the furthest end of the pier. It was detached and by clever planning was not overlooked (even the courtyard was totally private). They provided a BBQ, and we ate steak and shrimp that night before retiring to the lovely bedroom to be serenaded to sleep by the waters below. Fantastic.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “OMG. Awesome, even on a cloudy day.”
Reviews.Author: MondayAlready
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a two bedroom bungalow close to the end of the pier. We reserved the bungalow a year in advance. We were so disappointed because of the weather, but once we saw our view, even on the overcast day we had, it was fabulous! I can't say enough about the location of this hotel. Phenomenal. I wish it wasn't a rainy weekend or we would have been at the beach below all day every day. As it turned out, the kids wasted no time in going to the beach once the sun broke through the clouds on the evening before our departure and the morning of our departure. In any event, every wonderful review is spot on! While it is on the pricey side, they have a unique property and you never have to leave the neighborhood. We ordered Papa John's Pizza one evening and sat at the table outside on our patio. The kids loved it. It was fun watching the surfers every morning, too. At check out, they asked if we wanted to reserve for the following year. We tried to get something earlier to avoid the overcast weather. No chance. It was all booked. So, we'll be back the same time next year. To be critical, don't expect luxury. It's not that kind of hotel. And, the second bathroom's shower did have an RV feel to it, but as a whole, the cottage was clean and pretty. Also, the pier is open to the public during daylight hours, so it is not especially private. Still, the whole experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Southern California Beaches”
Reviews.Author: Morobi
Reviews.Content: If you want San Diego beach luxury, book into the Hotel Del Coronado. If you want the true beach experience, the Crystal Pier is unmatched. As a San Diego resident for more than three decades, I've always been intrigued by this landmark hotel, so when we were hosting our out-of-state grandkids, it seemed like a natural. And it was. Fishing at the end of the pier, breakfast at famous Kono's restaurant a block away, riding bikes down a leisurely boardwalk, boogie boarding, you name it, and it's all right there. I considered not rating this hotel because it is already booked so far ahead, but as a Trip Advisor advocate when we're planning to travel, I decided to post our experience. A fantastic experience, and great memories for all. Very pleased with our visit experience in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great but don't go in the winter”
Reviews.Author: GHal05
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier was wonderful, great rooms, awesome view, very relaxing EXCEPT when I went this past Feb, 2010, the nights were really bad. I left a horrific snow blizzard on the East Coast only to have horrible nights on the pier. I stayed in a cottage at the end of the pier. Not sure if it was the winter weather or what but every single night, the wind would whip around the cottage all night long sounding like a tornado. The ocean crashed into the pier and would make this horrible banging noise all night long. All 3 of us were freaked out every night because the noise from the wind and ocean was so very loud and scary it sounded like we were in a haunted house.

Reviews.Title: “Still the BEST of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: herbieBme
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at Crystal Pier. Love the location, the cottages and the ambiance of everything. Pricey, but well worth it. Save $$$ by BBQ'ing on your patio and fixing Bfast in the Cottage. Love the fact that they close the pier after sunset and open around 8 a.m. Save all year for this one week of enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Pier - one of the best places we have stayed in San Diego for the price”
Reviews.Author: viennabrez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at Crystal Pier in San Diego in a one bedroom cottage, #6, which faced North towards La Jolla. We had an excellent experience, traveling with 10 year old twins, who shared the queen size futon in the living room. The futon was very comfortable. The queen bed in the bedroom was also comfortable and came with 4 pillows to sleep on (2 per person). Kitchen had cookware and dinnerware to prepare meals and a kitchen table that sat 4 comfortably. The staff was most friendly and helpful at all times. The even called me several days before to confirm our reservation and verify what time we would be arriving. The cottages sit on the pier so there is no noise and disruption from the boardwalk traffic. The pier is gated and closes to the public (the public fishes off the end of the pier) at 8 PM. We even say dolphins in the water from the pier. It was one of the best places to stay in Mission Beach area. We hope to be able to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay up for an Oceanview room when you can be ON the Ocean?”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: The location of this historic inn is really, really cool. You are literally ON the pier. Cottages line the pier looking North and South along Pacific Beach. Ours was a 1 bd suite so the price would actually be less than 2 Ocean Front hotel rooms elsewhere. The units are historic and a bit "beachy funky" but exceptionally clean. It didn't appear recently painted but everyting was clean and white. We loved being lulled to sleep by the sound of the surf. Our Queen bed in the 1 bd suite was comfortable but the rollaway and futon sofa could use some help. Since they knew we were staying with 2 teens, it would have been nice for them to have the extra beds made on our arrival. Sheets and towels were fresh and of decent quality. Bathrooms were clean but could also use updating. Mini kitchen was stocked with all the necessities for a casual breakfast on the porch or romantic wine and cheese at sunset. Cottages are detached so we heard nothing from our neighboring guests. Just steps outside the gate there were TONS of restaurants, clubs, shops, the boardwalk, bike and surfboard rentals, etc. Everything you could need for a fun beach getaway. It is a VERY busy area especially on the weekend. Yes, the whole unit shakes and moves when a car rolled on it's to one of the further units on the pier (these would be the only cars that would be permitted so there is not a constant flow of traffic). We found that kind of funny and part of the charm. No internet and a tiny, old style TV but who cares when your watching the surfers, beach goers and kite surfers out the window instead. It's not the Ritz but it's unique and historic and has a killer view!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay if you love the beach!”
Reviews.Author: sunnynoodle
Reviews.Content: My husband, me and our 4 yr. old stayed at Crystal Pier for 3 days. It was a great experience. The staff were courteous, unlike some of the reviews I've read before I went. We booked the room a week prior so there was only one room left. It was one of the balcony ones, not one of the ones on the pier, but the view is still gorgeous. Yes, it is costly... but most hotels with a ocean view will cost just as much. Although there is no free continental breakfast, but right across the street is Kono's restaurant, which is one of the best breakfast place we've been to. Their pancakes were the BEST! My husband loved the breakfast burrito too... Must try if you stay at Crytal Pier! We bought ours togo and just sit at our balcony and enjoy our million dollar view. Priceless! The hotel is very close to Sea World, which is another plus. We hope to go back another time and stay for few more days. Maybe for a special occasion. :)

Reviews.Title: “Enter at your risk & be prepared to lose your hard earned vacation $ !”
Reviews.Author: paradisesd
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times before and thought it was a lovely, romantic experience. Not so this time. We live in SD and after 2 days of beautiful sunshine we headed down to CP for our Christmas Gift....When we got there and checked in..we discovered the end of the pier was closed, 20 feet beyond our cabin, a disappointment because it is lovely to walk at night.... "How odd" we thought, but left our suitcase behind and went to dinner. We returned after 8PM, when the office closes. By 10PM our unit was rocking and rolling...as there was apparently an extreme high surf event, that we had no idea was going on. It was frightening as every wave that crashed, rattled everything in the cottage, the mirror on the wall bouncing, clothes in the closets swinging back and forth, more or less a non stop earthquake....we had stayed here before, twice, and lived in SD 30 years....we knew this was NOT normal! A search for an emergency number yielded a number to call only if "mechanical emergency" (not our case) or 911 but not a manager ....we were up all night and at 5PM the SD NEWS reported that "all piers" in SD were close due to structural concerns..we meanwhile were paying $300 to stay 20 ft from the blocked off area. We gathered our things and left to Denny's where we waited till 8AM for the manager, When we reported that we had left due to fear and reports on the TV that all piers in SD had been officially closed by the city...and were considered unstable. The manager scoffed that they had been hit by 25 foot waves and the pier had not gone down, and these were only 16...we were refunded the next night's stay but they would not refund for the sleepless night and having to leave for our own safety, when no one could be reached. We were told it was our responsibility to know what the surf hieght was going to be, not their's, they after all did not control the weather ...so now you know...the weather (outside of the high surf) was perfect, we had no way of knowing of this problem.....shame on the Crystal Pier.! If they are closed by the city, they should have had the courtesy to warn the customers & refund the money to those who are not brave enough to stay out on the pier in defiance of the city order. Amazingly we were never told a thing by the mangement, we watched it on TV when we were wide awake at 5AM...and I should mention, that by 5AM everytime a wave hit, the lights flickered and went out, adding to the fear that something was amiss! We don't have $300 to waste on this kind of thing and tell ourselves we are having a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but expensive”
Reviews.Author: little_m0nkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in cottage 10 for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. The cottage was lovely and the view straight onto the beach was great - especially at sunset. Bad points - very expensive at over $1000 for 3 nights. The whole pier shakes when a car drives down which is a bit unnerving! Didn't like the area (pacific beach) - full of young college students and tacky bars, would be nicer in a more peaceful setting. Would recommend it though if cost isn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nine years in a row - can't wait for #10 next year”
Reviews.Author: ASU_Sundevils
Reviews.Content: I always look forward to staying at Crystal Pier hotel - this was my family's (me, wife, daughter [age 9]) ninth straight year at Crystal Pier. We had a great time; all I'm looking for at Crystal Pier is a chance to decompress and put the stress of work behind me. Crystal Pier never fails to deliver. My previous review from last year provides all the details about the hotel. This place is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Cottage 22 is a no but overall the Pier is a yes.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachfreak
Reviews.Content: I was invited to tag along with some friends that were staying at the Crystal Pier for a few days and I am so glad I did. The location is amazing, the cottages are nicely furnished and the sunsets from the pier are spectacular. A few negatives; we were given cottage 22 which appears to be the â€œruntâ€� of the cottages. It didnâ€™t have a futon as the other cottages have but it did have two twin size roll out beds. We had our own patio but it was so small that it only contained one lounge chair and a small round table with two (not four) patio chairs and no umbrella. The kitchen was so small that we couldnâ€™t reach the microwave unless we moved the dining chairs away from the table. Another issue was that none of the outlets in the kitchen worked except the one the toaster and coffee pot were already plugged into. From what I could see of the other cottages, ours appeared quite a bit smaller. We were disappointed that we didnâ€™t have a French door as the other cottages did and we had to park a good distance from our front door and not in front of the cottage as other guests could. The parking was a nightmare too. You are only allowed one assigned parking spot per cottage and you get locked in by all the other cars lined up bumper to bumper. The front desk clerk was grumpy about us driving through the gate before we got a key but no one was outside to tell us not to. She was less than friendly at check in. Youâ€™d think the front desk staff would be a little nicer and more professional for the amount of money you pay to stay there. The bathroom was fine and the shower had great water pressure. We brought lots of food with us and even made a big dinner one night. The kitchen did have all the basic necessities (pots, pans, dishes & utensils). You can also get a barbeque grill from the front desk (you provide the charcoal). All in all, it was a fabulous stay. I will definitely return but wonâ€™t stay in Cottage 22 again. I donâ€™t think it warrants the same rate as the other larger 1 bedroom units. There are also tons of shops and restaurants very close. I recommend visiting Pangaea for a cool shopping experience but make sure you have enough time to see everything in this large and very diverse store. Also, try Bustamanteâ€™s on Garnet Ave. We had a fantastic breakfast/lunch. Good selection on the menu; Mexican cuisine, plus omelets, pancakes, Belgium waffles, you name it. All very good food made from scratch. Good sized servings and each meal came with a fruit cup to start. Also, Edgar is the best waiter/host you can ask for. He went out of his way to make sure we had a great time and everyone at the table was happy. Be careful not to park on Garnet Street overnight though. I got a $40 ticket for being there between 3am â€“ 6am Tuesday morning when the street sweeper came around.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SPARKLELasVegas
Reviews.Content: If you want a truly relaxing, unique experience-be sure and "sleep over the ocean". After a very disappointing non-check in experience at another hotel in Pacific Beach-we were frantically trying to find another place to stay and fortunately the Crystal Pier Hotel and Cottages had a vacancy. We were so surprised as we know how popular this location can be. We stayed here two nights and slept better than we had in a long time. The first night our heater didn't work, but the next day as soon as we informed them, it was fixed within fifteen minutes. The cottages are so private and provide all amenities you would need with a well stocked kitchen-even had salt and pepper. The blue and white "beach cottage" interior is more casual than an upscale hotel, however you immediately feel "at home". You can drive right onto the pier in front of your door. The pier was closed for rennovations during our stay, however we still had spectacular views of the ocean, and sunset. Very close to everything. Staff was very accomodating making us feel very welcome. We loved this place and hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Pier..Relaxation to the fullest”
Reviews.Author: Lotticlan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were first introduced to Crystal Pier in 2004 by my mother who has been a frequent visitor to the hotel for some time now. We had planned a trip to Disneyland on the first leg of out vacation, and immediately following that needed a break from the mass of people at the park and booked a stay at the Hotel. When you first arrive you are immediately greeted with the ocean breeze and the crash of waves against the shore. This alone made me a realize I was in for some good old down time. After we checked in we were given the keys to our rooms and upon entering were greeted with a great view of the ocean just outside the sliding class doors to out patio. The cottage has a full kitchen. Pots, pans silverware, plates the whole nine yards. This was great. If you just wanted to stay "home" for the evening you could cook up a meal for yourself and your family. If this is along your speed, you are able to stock up on groceries at the local supermarket which is within walking distance of the Hotel. The sunsets from the pier are some of the most beautiful I've seen. The boardwalk is open to the public during the day, but is gated in the evening 7 or 8 p.m I believe, giving guests full run of the boardwalk. If you should venture out in the evening, you have your own key to the gate for after hours. When you finally do return from your evening you can rest assured that you are going to have the best nights sleep...EVER!! The sound of the tide beneath you and the gentle rocking of the pier rocks you right to sleep. There are a host of restaurants and lounges in the area. All of which accommodate different tastes in cuisine and nightlife as well. A list of family entertainment options can be found by just clicking around the the internet, brochures at the hotel, locals etc. Of course there is the San Diego Zoo, Sea World. The Mission at San Juan Capistrano..Disneyland isn't out of the question either, it's only 1 1/2 to 2 hrs drive and makes or a great day for you or the kids. The is so much more I could say about the Hotel, but I would be writing a novel y the end of this review. I would absolutely suggest that you give the Crystal Pier Hotel and Cottages a visit. I have some pictures of last years vacation and have just book some dates for may of 2009! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: PESA505
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier is great if your looking for beautiful view's and a nice clean comfortable room. I stayed at a "cottage" a few hotels over that was the same price and it pailed in comparison. I enjoyed the fact that they close the pier off to the public once it get's dark so only the people staying there have access. I have a nice classic car and it was great knowing that nobody would mess with it once it became dark, plus you can park your car right in front of your room. After staying at the Crystal Pier I don't want to stay anywhere else in San Diego! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Build over the water”
Reviews.Author: washaw
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a stay with our best friends on his birthday. The sunset was so beautiful. The wave gently wash up below the rooms and make a lovely sound for sleeping. Each cottage is decorated beautifully and is very comfortable. The patio out your backdoor is private with a gate that opens onto the pier, also private just for you and the other hotel guests. This is truly an amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dstivescpa
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier is one-of-a-kind never to be duplicated. We passed by the Pier a few years ago and promised to stay there on our next visit. We really enjoyed our stay for 2 nights over the Pacific rocking with the waves. The faciliy is old, but very well maintained. Our cottage was well furnished and provided a great opportunity to entertain some San Diego friends who had never been on the Pier. They loved it too. We did some cooking and enjoyed watching the surfers, birds and boats all around us. We will go back every time we are in the San Diego area. It is great unless you don't like being near water.

Reviews.Title: “favorite place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sandieg0native
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say how much we love staying at these great cottages. I am born & raised in San Diego & this is my favorite place to stay for a local getaway. We have been going there at least once a year for the past 10 years or so & have always had an excellent time. I have read some reviews that talk about unfriendly staff, but we have never encountered anything like that as everyone has been very helpful & friendly. We have stayed in some of the newer, larger cottages towards the end of the pier & also the older, but totally refurbished other cottages & they are all wonderful. The newer ones are a little more expensive, but have a little more privacy on your balcony area--except for the last 1 on each side of the pier--as those don't have the privacy the other "newer" cottages as you can see onto the balcony if you are standing on the pier. We pack our groceries & head down there & park our car & don't have to drive anywhere. They have full kitchens & they will bring you a bbq to your balcony to keep for your stay, if you ask. Talk about a romantic, candlelight dinner---doesn't get much better than that. There are lots of close places to walk to as well, if you don't want to cook. The cottages are spotlessly clean & all have a seperate bedroom area & large balcony with table/chairs & 2 lounge chairs. You won't want to leave :)

Reviews.Title: “Out to sea”
Reviews.Author: Stonewell
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to have Suite B, which is at the tip of the pier with unblocked views of the Pacific. Unparalled sunrises and sunsets were ours each of our 3 days. We particularly enjoyed watching the surfers from a birds eye view. We made use of our kitchenette, bringing in groceries from the Voss Supermarket right on Garnet St.We had no problems with noise or the visitors who are allowed on the pier during the day. I imagine the atmosphere is different in full summertime but our time here in April was perfect. We were 10-13 minutes to Old Town , the airport and La Jolla. Staff (and pier dogs!) is friendly but you are on your own before 8 AM and after 8 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the Pier”
Reviews.Author: jeroen020
Reviews.Content: We heard it was very hard to get a room at this hotel, but we tried nevertheless - and got lucky. Very lucky in fact - when we showed up at the property, we got an upgrade from a one bedroom suite to a two bedroom cottage. We stayed for two nights and it was absolutely terrific, a spotless cottage with a great sunset from the huge terrace, cosy bedrooms, each with a bathroom, a living with kitchen corner and a gentle rocking at night from the waves hitting the wooden pier. It was the highlight of our trip in CA and we'll definitely try to stay here again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!!”
Reviews.Author: norahcherokee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Crystal Pier a couple of times over the years. I lived in Pacific Beach (1978-1985) and always admired the cottages. I moved back east; when I decided to vacation in San Diego in 1991; I stayed at Crystal Pier. I vacationed in San Diego again in 1995 and 2000 staying at Crystal Pier each visit. I've always stayed in the lettered cottages and each visit I stayed a week. It was an absolute dream each stay. There is nothing more soothing or relaxing than sleeping over the Ocean; no matter what your day was like, you will wake up VERY well rested. When I vacation in San Diego again (hopefully soon) I will be staying at Crystal Pier. Love it!!!! NOTE: I had to check a year of stay for this to go through, which is why I listed the times of my stays.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Caitlinsgranmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for the first time with a group of friends and found the place to be exactly as described and then some. Our unit, No. 11, was great except for the fact the electrical outlets in the bedroom did not work. Other than that everything was great and we loved the atmosphere most of all. We had a pot luck dinner so it was handy to have a little kitchen complete with everything we needed to cook. The Bedroom is on the small side and all beds are queens but it was very comfortable and the sound of the ocean made for a great night of sleep. We have aleady made plans to return and would recommend this for anyone wanting a beach experience. Would not choose it for my honeymoon but definitely for a great weekend getaway. Do make sure to get an email confirmation we did not and found out later we almost lost our reservatioon since paperwork was not processed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the simple life at the Crystal Pier Cottages”
Reviews.Author: Dennis_Mary
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Crystal Pier Cottages, so needless to say we have mostly positive things to say about this hotel. We went in 2005 for our 25th wedding anniversary, just returned from celebrating our 27th there, plan to return, and constantly recommend it to our friends. We're in our mid-50's to give you an idea of our demographic, and we always look for places that are out of the ordinary when planning our trips. First some responses to previous reviewer comments: * Yes, this is a simply appointed property. If you want a lavishly decorated typical hotel room, with a pool, gym, room service, free newspaper, continental breakfast, etc., don't go here. By the way, don't believe the previous reviewer comments about shabby or less than adequate rooms. The hotel has upgraded the cottages and they are all nicely, if simply, furnished in a beach cottage theme that is carried out in the living, dining, and bedrooms. Even the plates, silverware, etc., continue the casual theme (think IKEA) and are something you would be happy to have in your home. * Parking is not that much of a strain. We have a Jeep Grand Cherokee and were able to maneuver on the pier and park in front of our cottage with little effort. So, unless you are driving a Hummer or something equally monstrous in size, don't worry. * Yes, it is sometimes a bit noisy nearby. Pacific Beach is a (surprise!) beach town, with all the noise that you should expect, including occasional people on the beach late at night/early a.m. (after the bars close, and there is now a nearby bar/club that wasn't there our first trip - not to worry: no real noise from the club itself or their customers). The noise factor on the beach at night isn't that big a deal and we managed to get back to sleep (the revelers left after about 30 minutes). Our cottage was not very far from the beginning of the pier and nearby street/businesses. I imagine cottages further out on the pier aren't as susceptible to this problem but there you do get more ocean noise, so it's a trade-off. So, if you want an absolutely (dead) quiet, perfectly furnished, e.g., some type of fussy Victorian or ultra-modern or cookie-cutter/Hilton/Hyatt/Radisson-type of hotel, go somewhere else. IF, on the other hand, you want to go to a marvelously charming, small hotel consisting of individual cottages located on a pier with to-die-for views of the Pacific Ocean and a nice, wide beach almost at your doorstep, go here. IF you want to listen to the ocean and watch it from your deck, living room, or while you are eating at your dining area table, all of which we did, then go here. IF you want to escape the normal boring, humdrum hotel scene and have some room to spread out in your living room, cook some light meals in the nicely equipped kitchen (or just warm up something in the microwave, go here. IF you want to be able to take a walk, roller blade, or ride your bikes (bring your own or rent them) along a nice stretch of paved "boardwalk" stretching for several miles along the beach, or walk along a very nice and family friendly beach, then go here. There are many nearby stores (Trader Joes, Ralphâ€™s, Vonâ€™s Henry's, Longâ€™s Drugs, to name a few) and some decent restaurants (don't expect a 5-star dining experience - beach town, not NYC or San Francisco, remember?). Kona's is next to the pier/hotel and has a great breakfast and lunch menu. The Green Flash, Joe's Crab Shack, and World Famous restaurants are a short walk from the pier and offer decent sit-down food, and there are lots of other smaller eating places nearby, plus the usual suspects (Denny's, McDonald's, Taco Bell, etc.). Be adventurous - try some of the local spots! Or, just cook in your cottage as we occasionally did. Nothing beats eating breakfast while looking at the Pacific Ocean! The main drag in Pacific Beach, Garnet Street, starts/ends at the pier and is a bit rowdy (lots of bars, tattoo places, etc.), but not enough that you don't feel safe at night. The presence of these establishments doesn't mean PB is a dump: the city of SD keeps it clean and well maintained. To the contrary, we enjoy the atmosphere of the area. Lots of college kids from SDSU, UCSD, and USD live and hang out in PB, but they seem fairly well-behaved and the SDPD seems to be present in adequate numbers and manages to keep a lid on things without an overwhelming presence. Downtown SD is about a 10-15 minute drive from PB with all the usual touristy stuff that you might want to enjoy (we highly recommend a trip to Little Italy in SD), but we like just hanging out in town, walking on the beach, riding bikes, grabbing a coffee in downtown PB, stopping in some of the shops, reading on the deck at our cottage, listening to music while eating breakfast, and enjoying the view and each other. Life, at least while we were staying there, is simple and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great View-Terrible Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: artfan
Reviews.Content: My mother-in-law used to stay at this property many years ago. The luster has obviously faded. While the physical property is interesting, this part of San Diego is a bit dumpy, unless you like homeless people sleeping all around you while you are on vacation at the beach. But the reall problem is the staff. To say they are below the standard for the hoteling world is an understandment. If I owned this place, they would all be replaced. It was extraordinary to have every person who I had an encounter with to have such a poor disposition. Beware of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best view, very relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: ChefGurl
Reviews.Content: You have to talk to an actual person to book here. So worth it. My mom, my 11 year daughter and myself stayed here for our spring break and had the best time. My mom was recovering from a serious illness and this was just what the Dr. ordered. The staff leaves you alone and lets you enjoy your holiday. The view is magnificent, the cottages are clean and un-cluttered. We loved it so much. I truly can't say enough about it. Loved it... The sounds of the ocean waves, the gulls, the peace of it all. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tymadmom
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous! Excellent location, beautiful rooms, close to all beach activities and shopping. If you've never tried it, you have really been missing out. Totally worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Crystal Pier Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MandiLonergan
Reviews.Content: The perfect escape! My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights in the hotel, number 25 on the second floor. We had a perfect view of Pacific Beach and watched the sun set from our balcony every night. The location is perfect. There are plenty of restaurants, shops, and the beach right there. The staff is so wonderful. The only complaint we had is the noise in the mornings. We stayed out late and didn't get up early, the noise from the street in the morning can be kind of annoying. I think if you stayed in cottages it would be a little less noisy. Otherwise it's the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It takes a lot to wow a local!”
Reviews.Author: cascole
Reviews.Content: My teenage son had been bugging me to get a cottage on the pier for quite some time. He frequently goes to the pier to fish & wanted to be a guest so he could go night fishing. After many months of pleading, last Sunday morning I told him to call & see if they happened to have anything available. I was amazed that they had one 2 bedroom unit over the water available for that night. (Usually a 2 night minimum, unless you call on the day before or day of arrival.) I was skepticle because it was pricy, but went ahead & took it. When we arrived, I was 'wowed'. The service was impecable. Quick check in just before driving onto the pier & the unit (#1) was ready & waiting for us. As we had a large unit, we were allowed 2 vehicles on the pier - which was a plus since I had friends coming to enjoy dinner with us. The unit seemed newly remodeled. Nice blue & white tile in the bathrooms & kitchen. A nautical theme throughout. The living area & kitchen were small - but the bedrooms were decent size. The master bedroom also had a sliding glass door out to the deck. We had a HUGE deck (probably the largest of all the units) right over the water complete with a bbq, 4 chaise lounges, 2 tables & about 8 chairs! For those with small children, the deck railings have been upgraded to 'code' so I didn't have to worry too much about my 2 year old lunging into the water, although he was never allowed outside without my oldest son or an adult anyway. There was a TV in the living area with DVD & VCR, as well as a small TV in the master bedroom. The kitchen is complete with a microwave, refrigerator, stove & oven, plates, utencils, pots & pans etc... I enjoyed falling asleep to the ocean waves - almost like falling asleep listening to a heavy rain storm. Unfortunately, my son didn't have much luck fishing - but I was won over by the Crystal Pier hotel & we will definately be back for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect litte beach stop”
Reviews.Author: 120Rocks
Reviews.Content: I loved the views, the room, the experience! We were walkin guests and were shown two choices, one of the cabins over the ocean on the pier and one of the much larger rooms on land with full on facing of the ocean, same price. We chose not to stay on the pier to get the full views offered by these rooms, a large private deck, living room, dining area, fully stocked kitchen, king bed in the bed room.... perfect! The beach scene in the winter is wonderfully romantic, lacking the hordes of touring families and children one usually finds. We just adored this trip. Outside our back windows was a little restaurant serving breakfast all day. All day it had a line to get in, so we decided to go first thing in the morning, no apparent line. When we got there the line was inside to keep the waiting warm. Alas, we aren't much for waiting and went elsewhere, but I imagine this breakfast joint is exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “my take on this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here it is in a nutshell... If you want a resort with lots to do, bellhops, room service, etc... than this is not the place for you. HOWEVER.... If you are the type that gets a whole day off every 2-4 years and want a place to get away... a simple place with all the right things... this place is perfect on many different levels. The fair sized "apartment style" room we had offered us (my wife and I) exactly what we needed. Space to relax and wind down - a beach with easy and fast access for morning and evening walks - a fridge for our vino, water, champagne, juice and some other goodies - a deck with a view (a fantastic view) with choice of chairs & table or loungers - a TV (kept neatly out of site as it should be when you're here) - Only 20 minutes or less from anything one could ask to see. Heck even the kitchens were equipped with many of the things we forgot. (Wine opener, glasses, etc.) The only glitche we experienced was with the parking but the staff addressed the matter and resolved it in literally 2 minutes. Here... it is all about you, the view, serenity, peace, seriously - after 4 years without a day off... Ahhhhhhh... Is all I really have to say. My wife said - if we never went anywhere - or went out at night - or never shopped, - if we just stayed there and did nothing but sit together - it would have still been a more than worth while trip. P.S. I went to their website after going - the photos they have up there do the place NO justice at all. It is far nicer than they depict it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views but noisy and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: echevin
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of my honeymoon and I stayed here for 3 nights mid-September based soley on the reviews on here as it was #1 and had been for some time. The room was very nice - quaint and basic. The views over the ocean were spectacular and that alone was worth it as was hearing the sound of the waves crashing all night. The staff were ok...not the friendliness you expect for paying the high price. The noise! there's some kind of bar about 20 steps away from the hotel which closes every night at 2am. I can't believe nobody has mentioned this because it is impossible to sleep if you are closer to the land-side of the pier. I mentioned this to the staff @ front desk who said they knew about it. I know there's nothing they can do but they didn't seem even slightly sorry. I would not stay here again for the following reasons: 1. Too pricey 2. Too noisy 3. I want to be nearer to the gaslamp and bay area However I would miss the view....

Reviews.Title: “Think again: What would you pay to "Sleep Over The Ocean"?”
Reviews.Author: carencn
Reviews.Content: The Crystal Pier is in the Pacific Beach section of San Diego. If I remember correctly, this is one of five beach communities north of the center city. It seems that locals refer to all five by their initials, so PB it is. I am from the East Coast, and to me PB looks like any other family oriented, especially teen-centric, beach town -- lots of sun and fun apparel shops, temporary tattoo parlors, fast food (including a Denny's), and loud music. My husband and I became Empty Nesters' earlier this month, and took off on a two week trip to the West Coast. I discovered The Crystal Pier Hotel on TripAdvisor.com -- though at the time it was rated as the #1 B&B, not as a hotel. I booked it for two nights (the minimum at this time of year) and we drove over from Palm Springs, where we spent a wonderful week at The Chase Hotel. I don't know if it was because we were coming from such a down-to-earth, non-touristy place like The Chase, or whatever... but I knew at first sight that I had made a mistake. The Crystal Pier is for the tourist that knows no better. I am embarrassed to admit that I am one of these. Though, perhaps, there are people that are willing to pay top dollar to stay in economy accommodations in a miniature "cottage" on an ocean pier where one can watch the local surfers brave the smallish waves? We were in Cottage #8, maybe a third of the way out on the pier. Each cottage has one parking space parallel to their cottage, and the cottage is not much wider than the car you will park there. Bring a small vehicle, because turning around to head out requires tight turning. Our cottage was a one-bedroom. You enter the cottage into the kitchen/common room. The bedroom was off to the right, the size of its queen size bed with barely walking distance around the bed. There was a sliding door from this bedroom into the bathroom (shower only, no tub), and from the bathroom a door back into the kitchen/common room -- a small, rather well equipped kitchen, half/round table with chairs, TV (only TV) and futon (I could not figure out how to flatten it). The kitchen/common room opened onto a small deck that had a table and chairs, and chaises -- and was butt-to-butt with decks on either side, and may have shared a common walkway from one pier end to the other. But you can sit and sip and enjoy the view of the beach and surfers below. The general condition of the cottage was "worn" -- outdated in all respects. However, it looked like the Crystal Pier was fully booked, so I was not the only sucker? Or, maybe I am not the typical tourist, and others will find The Crystal Pier more appealing. Highlights: Maria was our attentive housekeeper, and Randy at the front desk called me minutes after we left to tell me I had left behind a jacket. While I was at the front desk checking out, I think it was the owner (or manager?) that came in with his elderly dog in a walking-sling, very touching. (Though at The Chase Hotel, I spent some time every morning at breakfast with Chase, the owner's dog he adopted as a stray.) FYI: The Crystal Pier Hotel is a "gated" community. You are given a key that opens the gate to bring through a car, or to open the walk-in gate after 8:pm. Bottom line: Just like all others, I fell in love with SD, but next trip I will not stay at the CP - in fact, I will not stay in PB or any other of the beaches. To experience the city, one must stay in the city. Yes?

Reviews.Title: “Cool cottage”
Reviews.Author: SBATustin
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 3 year-old son and I spent 3 days here. We stayed here on a Mon,Tues and Wed (Aug 29-Sept 1). We felt we were lucky we didn't stay here over the weekend because Pacific Beach is busy!. I could imagine it being too crowded. As for the cottage, we stayed in #10. We were over dry land but still on the pier. We enjoyed beautiful sunsets on the patio with our friends who visited and we enjoyed the surfers from early morning 'til sunset. Surfing is not allowed on the left side of the pier. The cottage is quaint and my son enjoyed it too. It was a good size for our little group. The furniture is tired looking and my husband feels the place needs a serious renovation. It definitely is not fancy. Inspite of the place's short-comings we had a great time. I love that it has a kitchen--you can enjoy it like its home (cut fruit, serve drinks...). It is in a fun location with a good beach. It's close to all the attractions in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Management!”
Reviews.Author: LD54
Reviews.Content: We previously stay at Crystal Pier and thought it was incredible so we made another reservation for May. Sadly, my mother passed away and I experienced some health problems so I needed to cancel. Although they have a no refund policy, they were so understanding and let me put my deposit into a holding account to be used at a more healthy time. I am so appreciative of their humanity!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at Crystal Pier”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2+ week trip to California and have to say that our stay at Crystal Pier was one of the highlights on the trip. We were lucky enough to have Cottage "B" at the very end of the pier. Upon our arrival, we sat out on our deck sipping wine and watching the surfers do their thing. After a few minutes, we noticed a trio of dolphins swimming along side them. What a sight to see! Later that night, we saw the most amazing sunset from that same deck. The Pacific Beach area itself isn't all that great - more or less a college party scene. However, if you ever have the oppty. to stay at Crystal Pier, go for it! You won't be disappointed with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Customer Service, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively, and can find no better place to relax and enjoy the company of our family but at the Crystal Pier. Contrary to a few (minority) of reviewers that rate the staff as uncourteous, we have always found the staff to be very accomodating and outstanding in their service to customers. The only thing I can think of is that these folks are writing poor reviews to "keep others" away and have the pier to themselves! It is true that the pier is quite popular and it is very difficult to get a reservation, but that all goes with being an outstanding property. I graciously give the Pier 5 STARS and recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “We are a few months away from our 4th visit...can't wait”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrate our anniversary at C.P. every year. The BIGGEST problem is that I start day-dreaming about the vacation months ahead of time. C.P. has everyting you could want in a vacation, very peaceful, yet plenty to do in walking distance. The cottages are like a cozy little home. The staff has always been very nice to us. If we need something, they help us and otherwise they let us enjoy our time on the pier with very little contact. It's like home, only someone else is makeing the bed and the view is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in The States”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Jen
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier is probably the best hotels that we were privileged to stay in during our 7 week vacation in the States. What an awesome setting and absolutely spotless. Crystal Pier should be on the Hotels of the World list. The little cabins on the pier - built in 1927 - are fully equipped for self catering purposes and the establishment is managed with a hands on approach by its owners who obviously love it - the passion shines through ! I can highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic place ever”
Reviews.Author: YGG
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely--you get your own little cabin, but what's truly fantastic is the privacy and the scenary. You feel like you on the edge of the world. It's just incredible. We had the honeymoon suite at the end of the pier and it was terrific. Neighborhood is cute--it's not fancy schmancy LaJolla, but Pacific Beach. A great breakfast cafe is walking distance, a downtown LaJolla is about a five minute drive. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on a pier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second vacation at the Crystal Pier and all I can say is the place is wonderful. The staff is polite and will will help you with anything you need. The views and the sunsets are outstanding. I would tell everyone that you must stay at the pier at least one time in your life to really grasp the meaning of heaven on a pier.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the most relaxing, enjoyable time in our adorable cottage, falling asleep to the wonderful sounds of the ocean and waves crashing on the shore beneath us, viewing the shoreline, watching the sunsets, admiring the surfers, and sunbathing on our private deck. The reception and housekeeping staff were very professional, polite, cheerful, and helpful. We were very pleased with everything about our stay. This was our first visit and we would highly recommend a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from noisy local bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Crystal Pier is a unique place to stay and we have just got back from a wonderful holiday. Some people have complained about the waves, but then we were booked into one of the apartments above the office (i.e one of the sides of the 'entry arch') These are bigger than the cottages, but the bedroom overlooks the street and 'Blind Melons' bar has fairly noisey live music until way after midnight - be warned

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Pier is the best place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Crystal Pier twice and can't wait to return. I have also read some of the reviews that are questionable in their disdain. One reviewer stated he arrived two hours early, driving from Sedona, AZ and wanted to park on property, but was told that was not possible. He cried that he had to use public parking until check-in time (2 pm). At 2 pm, the room was still not ready, but he was able to park at that time. First, it's a frequent occurrence that rooms are not ready, especially at Crystal Pier because folks simply do NOT want to leave this wonderful place and stay right up until the required check out time. Later in his little tirade, he stated that he was not allowed to take blankets out of the cottage. His excuse for disregarding a posted rule was that he had flown in and didn't have the capacity to pack extra belongings. Hmmm, earlier he insinuated that he arrived early from AZ and wanted to park on property. I guess he must have rented a car, but his little narrative sounds suspect to me! All in all, no vacation destination is perfect. Crystal Pier however is a wonderful place to unwind and relax. Yes, you must rely on doing your homework to find out exactly what the rates are at different times of the year, but that is true with most destinations. The staff has always been very helpful and accommodating to my family and we have family and friends who religiously return twice, annually. Most of the folks who belittle Crystal Pier (C.P.) didn't take responsibility to make their own vacation a wonderful experience and should NOT put it on the shoulders of C.P. to do everything for them!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pier twice now. Each time was awesome. If you want a place to relax and get away from it all, this is the place. We can't imagine every staying in a regular hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We called at the last minute and was lucky they had a cancellation. It was a great weekend. The front desk was very nice, friendly despite the negitive reveiws. The cottage was very clean, we had a wonderful ocean view. We awoke to waves, surfers and sea gulls. I thought I was in heaven for a short time. We will stay again next time we escape to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you can overlook the front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the strangest places around -- attractive, quaint cottages right over the beach and/or ocean, UNBELIEVABLE views, well located for restaurants, etc., but has the worst front desk/reservations people I've ever encountered at a hotel. Unfortunately, it's not just a problem of the owners not knowing-- one of the rudest people you'll talk to is one of the owners. They know they have a unique property, with many people coming year after year (despite the attitude) so they don't have to improve their customer service. If you can overlook that aspect of things, this is a wonderful place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Crystal Pier Hotel & Cottages
HotelInfo.Address: 4500 Ocean Blvd., San Diego, CA 92109
